moves.1. e4: I know I got lucky, a couple of errors created the best knight game I have ever had, and right through it I had hanging knights on a couple of occasions.
moves.5... Na5 6. Bxf7+: I decided to sac the white bishop for a little play on the fact that he could not castle to safety.
moves.12. Nxe5: Playing Bxe5 would solve blacks problem here, think he had other plans and like me did not foresee things to come, or he just missed it
moves.12... Qxe4 13. Qxh5+: setting up for things to come with 2 hanging nights
moves.13... Kd8 14. Nf7+: Here initially I thought the best move was Nxh8, turns out it was not, the sectet was keeping him in chck and I could not do that by taking the Rook 1st
moves.14... Ke8 15. Nxd6+: 3 points made easy, double check..., playing Kf8 woudl be mate
moves.16... Ke8 17. Nxh8+: 5 pointer, check, again Kf8 is mate
moves.20... c6: c6 does not give escape as Nd6 covers c6, perhaps d6 would have given some releive
moves.21. Bg5+: Sac to get the pawns out and get Ke8
moves.21... hxg5 22. Qxg5+ Ke8 23. Qe7#: I actually felt sorry for my opponent, I though he made one bad choice and paid heavily.  At least he had the courage to see it through!
